00023 #define OBIX_WATCH_IN_TEMPLATE_HEADER ("<obj is=\"obix:WatchIn\">\r\n" \
00024                                                                    "  <list name=\"hrefs\" of=\"obix:Uri\">\r\n")
00025 #define OBIX_WATCH_IN_TEMPLATE_HEADER_LENGTH 62
00026 
00027 #define OBIX_WATCH_IN_TEMPLATE_URI "    <uri val=\"%s\"/>\r\n"
00028 #define OBIX_WATCH_IN_TEMPLATE_URI_LENGTH 19
00029 
00030 #define OBIX_WATCH_IN_TEMPLATE_FOOTER ("  </list>\r\n" \
00031                                                                    "</obj>")
00032 #define OBIX_WATCH_IN_TEMPLATE_FOOTER_LENGTH 17
00033 
00034 #define OBIX_WRITE_REQUEST_TEMPLATE "<%s href=\"%s\" val=\"%s\"/>"
00035 #define OBIX_WRITE_REQUEST_TEMPLATE_LENGTH 18

00086 static const char* removeServerAddress(const char* uri, Http_Connection* c)
00087 {
00088     if (strncmp(uri, c->serverUri, c->serverUriLength) == 0)
00089     {
00090         return (uri + c->serverUriLength);
00091     }
00092     else
00093     {
00094         return uri;
00095     }
00096 }

00098 // TODO think about moving it to obix_utils
00099 static char* ixmlElement_getFullHref(IXML_Element* element,
00100                                      Http_Connection* c, BOOL full)
00101 {
00102     // helper function for uri concatenation
00103     char* concatUri(const char* parent, int parentLength, char* child)
00104     {
00105         char* newUri = (char*) malloc(strlen(child) + parentLength + 1);
00106         if (newUri == NULL)
00107         {
00108             log_error("Unable to generate full URI for <%s/>: "
00109                       "Not enough memory.", ixmlElement_getTagName(element));
00110             free(child);
00111             return NULL;
00112         }
00113         strncpy(newUri, parent, parentLength);
00114         strcpy(newUri + parentLength, child);
00115         free(child);
00116         return newUri;
00117     }
00118 
00119     const char* attrValue = ixmlElement_getAttribute(element, OBIX_ATTR_HREF);
00120 
00121     // if we do not need to return server address, but href attribute already
00122     // contains it, than drop it
00123     if (!full && (strncmp(attrValue, c->serverUri, c->serverUriLength) == 0))
00124     {
00125         attrValue += c->serverUriLength;
00126     }
00127     char* uri = ixmlCloneDOMString(attrValue);
00128 
00129     if (uri == NULL)
00130     {
00131         log_error("Element <%s/> doesn't have \"%s\" attribute.",
00132                   ixmlElement_getTagName(element), OBIX_ATTR_HREF);
00133         return NULL;
00134     }
00135 
00136     // append parent's URI until we have URI starting from '/' or
00137     // from server address
00138     IXML_Element* parent = element;
00139     while((*uri != '/') &&
00140             (strncmp(c->serverUri, uri, c->serverUriLength) != 0))
00141     {
00142         parent = ixmlNode_convertToElement(
00143                      ixmlNode_getParentNode(
00144                          ixmlElement_getNode(parent)));
00145         if (parent == NULL)
00146         {
00147             // we do not have enough parent objects in the document in order
00148             // to create the full URI
00149             log_error("Unable to generate full URI for <%s/>. "
00150                       "Output should start with either \"/\" or \"%s\", "
00151                       "but it is \"%s\".",
00152                       ixmlElement_getTagName(element), c->serverUri, uri);
00153             free(uri);
00154             return NULL;
00155 
00156         }
00157 
00158         const char* parentUri =
00159             ixmlElement_getAttribute(parent, OBIX_ATTR_HREF);
00160 
00161         if (parentUri == NULL)
00162         {       // this parent doesn't have href attribute, try next parent
00163             continue;
00164         }
00165         // if we do not need to return server address, but parent contains it
00166         // than drop it
00167         if (!full &&
00168                 (strncmp(parentUri, c->serverUri, c->serverUriLength) == 0))
00169         {
00170             parentUri += c->serverUriLength;
00171         }
00172 
00173         int parentUriLength = strlen(parentUri);
00174         if (parentUriLength == 0)
00175         {
00176             log_error("Unable to generate full URI for <%s/>. "
00177                       "Data is corrupted.", ixmlElement_getTagName(element));
00178             free(uri);
00179             return NULL;
00180         }
00181 
00182         if (parentUri[parentUriLength - 1] != '/')
00183         {
00184             // we want to concat parent's uri with ours. But we have to use
00185             // parents URI until it's last slash. Example:
00186             // <parent href="/a/b" ><child href="c" /></parent>
00187             // in that case child's href="/a/c
00188             for (parentUriLength -= 2;
00189                     (parentUriLength > 0) && (parentUri[parentUriLength] != '/');
00190                     parentUriLength--)
00191                 ;
00192 
00193             if (parentUriLength <= 0)
00194             {
00195                 // there is nothing to be copied from this uri, go to the next
00196                 // parent element
00197                 continue;
00198             }
00199             // increase length so that trailing slash is also copied
00200             parentUriLength++;
00201         }
00202 
00203         // concatenate our URI with parents
00204         uri = concatUri(parentUri, parentUriLength, uri);
00205     }
00206 
00207     if (full && (*uri == '/'))
00208     {   // add server address if full URI is needed, but it is not a full yet.
00209         uri = concatUri(c->serverUri, c->serverUriLength, uri);
00210     }
00211 
00212     return uri;
00213 }
00214 
00215 static char* getObjectUri(IXML_Document* doc,
00216                           const char* objName,
00217                           Http_Connection* c,
00218                           BOOL full)
00219 {
00220     IXML_Element* element = ixmlDocument_getElementByAttrValue(
00221                                 doc,
00222                                 OBIX_ATTR_NAME,
00223                                 objName);
00224     if (element == NULL)
00225     {
00226         log_error("Object \"%s\" is not found in the server response.",
00227                   objName);
00228         return NULL;
00229     }
00230 
00231     char* uri = ixmlElement_getFullHref(element, c, full);
00232     if (uri == NULL)
00233     {
00234         log_error("Unable to retrieve full URI for the object \"%s\".",
00235                   objName);
00236     }
00237     return uri;
00238 }

00240 static void resetWatchUris(Http_Connection* c)
00241 {
00242     if (c->watchAddUri != NULL)
00243     {
00244         free(c->watchAddUri);
00245         c->watchAddUri = NULL;
00246     }
00247     if (c->watchDeleteUri != NULL)
00248     {
00249         free(c->watchDeleteUri);
00250         c->watchDeleteUri = NULL;
00251     }
00252     if (c->watchRemoveUri != NULL)
00253     {
00254         free(c->watchRemoveUri);
00255         c->watchRemoveUri = NULL;
00256     }
00257     if (c->watchPollChangesFullUri != NULL)
00258     {
00259         free(c->watchPollChangesFullUri);
00260         c->watchPollChangesFullUri = NULL;
00261     }
00262 }
00263 
00264 static char* getWatchInString(const char** paramUri, int count)
00265 {
00266     // calculate size of WatchIn object
00267     int size = OBIX_WATCH_IN_TEMPLATE_HEADER_LENGTH;
00268     int i;
00269     for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
00270     {
00271         size += OBIX_WATCH_IN_TEMPLATE_URI_LENGTH + strlen(paramUri[i]);
00272     }
00273     size += OBIX_WATCH_IN_TEMPLATE_FOOTER_LENGTH + 1;
00274 
00275     char* watchIn = (char*) malloc(size);
00276     if (watchIn == NULL)
00277     {
00278         return NULL;
00279     }
00280 
00281     // print header
00282     strcpy(watchIn, OBIX_WATCH_IN_TEMPLATE_HEADER);
00283     size = OBIX_WATCH_IN_TEMPLATE_HEADER_LENGTH;
00284     // print URIs
00285     for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
00286     {
00287         size += sprintf(watchIn + size, OBIX_WATCH_IN_TEMPLATE_URI, paramUri[i]);
00288     }
00289     // print footer
00290     strcpy(watchIn + size, OBIX_WATCH_IN_TEMPLATE_FOOTER);
00291 
00292     return watchIn;
00293 }
00294 
00295 static int writeValue(const char* paramUri,
00296                       const char* newValue,
00297                       OBIX_DATA_TYPE dataType,
00298                       CURL_EXT* curlHandle)
00299 {
00300     // generate request body
00301     const char* objName = *(OBIX_DATA_TYPE_NAMES[dataType]);
00302     char* requestBody = (char*)
00303                         malloc(OBIX_WRITE_REQUEST_TEMPLATE_LENGTH
00304                                + strlen(objName)
00305                                + strlen(paramUri)
00306                                + strlen(newValue) + 1);
00307     if (requestBody == NULL)
00308     {
00309         log_error("Unable to write to the oBIX server: "
00310                   "Not enough memory.");
00311         return OBIX_ERR_NO_MEMORY;
00312     }
00313     sprintf(requestBody, OBIX_WRITE_REQUEST_TEMPLATE,
00314             objName, paramUri, newValue);
00315 
00316     // send request
00317     curlHandle->outputBuffer = requestBody;
00318     int error = curl_ext_put(curlHandle, paramUri);
00319     free(requestBody);
00320     if (error != 0)
00321     {
00322         log_error("Unable to write to the server %s: "
00323                   "curl_ext_put() returned %d.", paramUri, error);
00324         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00325     }
00326 
00327     // we do not use parseResponse here to check for error, because
00328     // generating DOM structure is quite slow.
00329     if (*(curlHandle->inputBuffer) == '\0')
00330     {
00331         log_warning("Server did not returned anything for PUT request. "
00332                     "Parameter \"%s\" can be left unchanged.", paramUri);
00333         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00334     }
00335 
00336     if (strstr(curlHandle->inputBuffer, "<err") != NULL)
00337     {
00338         log_warning("Server's answer for PUT request contains error object. "
00339                     "Parameter \"%s\" can be left unchanged:\n%s",
00340                     paramUri, curlHandle->inputBuffer);
00341         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00342     }
00343 
00344     return OBIX_SUCCESS;
00345 }
00346 
00347 static int addWatchItem(Http_Connection* c,
00348                         const char** paramUri,
00349                         int count,
00350                         IXML_Document** response,
00351                         CURL_EXT* curlHandle)
00352 {
00353     char fullWatchAddUri[c->serverUriLength + strlen(c->watchAddUri) + 1];
00354     strcpy(fullWatchAddUri, c->serverUri);
00355     strcat(fullWatchAddUri, c->watchAddUri);
00356     char *requestBody = getWatchInString(paramUri, count);
00357 
00358     if (requestBody == NULL)
00359     {
00360         log_error("Unable to register new listener: Not enough memory.");
00361         return OBIX_ERR_NO_MEMORY;
00362     }
00363     curlHandle->outputBuffer = requestBody;
00364     int error = curl_ext_postDOM(curlHandle, fullWatchAddUri, response);
00365     free(requestBody);
00366 
00367     if (error != 0)
00368     {
00369         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00370     }
00371     return OBIX_SUCCESS;
00372 }
00373 
00374 static int createWatch(Http_Connection* c, CURL_EXT* curlHandle)
00375 {
00376     char* watchAddUri = NULL;
00377     char* watchRemoveUri = NULL;
00378     char* watchPollChangesFullUri = NULL;
00379     char* watchDeteleUri = NULL;
00380     IXML_Document* response = NULL;
00381 
00382     // helper function for memory cleaning on errors
00383     void cleanup()
00384     {
00385         if (watchAddUri != NULL)
00386             free(watchAddUri);
00387         if (watchRemoveUri != NULL)
00388             free(watchRemoveUri);
00389         if (watchPollChangesFullUri != NULL)
00390             free(watchPollChangesFullUri);
00391         if (watchDeteleUri != NULL)
00392             free(watchDeteleUri);
00393         if (response != NULL)
00394             ixmlDocument_free(response);
00395     }
00396     // form the URI of watchService.make operation
00397     char makeUri[c->serverUriLength + strlen(c->watchMakeUri) + 1];
00398     strcpy(makeUri, c->serverUri);
00399     strcat(makeUri, c->watchMakeUri);
00400 
00401     curlHandle->outputBuffer = NULL;
00402     curl_ext_postDOM(curlHandle, makeUri, &response);
00403     if (response == NULL)
00404     {
00405         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00406     }
00407 
00408     watchAddUri = getObjectUri(response, OBIX_NAME_WATCH_ADD, c, FALSE);
00409     watchRemoveUri = getObjectUri(response, OBIX_NAME_WATCH_REMOVE, c, FALSE);
00410     watchDeteleUri = getObjectUri(response, OBIX_NAME_WATCH_DELETE, c, FALSE);
00411     // we store complete URI of pollChanges operation because we use it more
00412     // often than others.
00413     watchPollChangesFullUri = getObjectUri(response, OBIX_NAME_WATCH_POLLCHANGES, c, TRUE);
00414     if ((watchAddUri == NULL)
00415             || (watchRemoveUri == NULL)
00416             || (watchDeteleUri == NULL)
00417             || (watchPollChangesFullUri == NULL))
00418     {
00419         log_error("watchService.make operation at server \"%s\" returned Watch "
00420                   "object in wrong format:\n"
00421                   "%s", c->serverUri, curlHandle->inputBuffer);
00422         cleanup();
00423         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00424     }
00425 
00426     // store all these URIs
00427     c->watchAddUri = watchAddUri;
00428     c->watchRemoveUri = watchRemoveUri;
00429     c->watchDeleteUri = watchDeteleUri;
00430     c->watchPollChangesFullUri = watchPollChangesFullUri;
00431 
00432     // try to set watch lease time
00433     char* watchLeaseUri = getObjectUri(response, OBIX_NAME_WATCH_LEASE, c, TRUE);
00434     ixmlDocument_free(response);
00435     if (watchLeaseUri == NULL)
00436     {
00437         log_warning("watchService.make operation at server \"%s\" returned Watch "
00438                     "object without \'%s\' tag:\n%s", c->serverUri,
00439                     OBIX_NAME_WATCH_LEASE, curlHandle->inputBuffer);
00440         free(watchLeaseUri);
00441         // do not consider this error as a big problem
00442         return OBIX_SUCCESS;
00443     }
00444 
00445     char* leaseTime = obix_reltime_fromLong(c->watchLease, RELTIME_SEC);
00446     if (leaseTime == NULL)
00447     {
00448         // this should never happen!
00449         log_error("Unable to convert Watch.lease time from long (%ld) to "
00450                   "obix:reltime!", c->watchLease);
00451         free(watchLeaseUri);
00452         cleanup();
00453         return OBIX_ERR_UNKNOWN_BUG;
00454     }
00455 
00456     int error = writeValue(watchLeaseUri,
00457                            leaseTime,
00458                            OBIX_T_RELTIME,
00459                            curlHandle);
00460     free(watchLeaseUri);
00461     free(leaseTime);
00462     if (error == OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION)
00463     {
00464         // server could return error just because it prevents changes of
00465         // Watch.lease. So we ignore this error.
00466         return OBIX_SUCCESS;
00467     }
00468 
00469     return error;
00470 }
00471 
00475 static int recreateWatch(Http_Connection* c,
00476                          IXML_Document** response,
00477                          CURL_EXT* curlHandle)
00478 {
00479     log_warning("Trying to create new Watch object...\nIf you often see this "
00480                 "message, try to set/increase <%s/> value in connection "
00481                 "settings (will help only if your oBIX server supports "
00482                 "changing Watch.lease), or reduce <%s/> value.",
00483                 CT_WATCH_LEASE, CT_POLL_INTERVAL);
00484     // reset old watch uri's.
00485     resetWatchUris(c);
00486     // create new watch
00487     int error = createWatch(c, curlHandle);
00488     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00489     {
00490         return error;
00491     }
00492     // add all watch items that we have in the list
00493     const char** uri;
00494     int count = table_getKeys(c->watchTable, &uri);
00495 
00496     return addWatchItem(c, uri, count, response, curlHandle);
00497 }
00498 
00499 static int parseResponse(IXML_Document* respDoc, IXML_Element** respElem)
00500 {
00501     IXML_Node* node = ixmlNode_getFirstChild(ixmlDocument_getNode(respDoc));
00502     // iterate until we find first xml element
00503     while((node != NULL) && (ixmlNode_getNodeType(node) != eELEMENT_NODE))
00504     {
00505         node = ixmlNode_getNextSibling(node);
00506     }
00507 
00508     if (node == NULL)
00509     {
00510         char* text = ixmlPrintDocument(respDoc);
00511         log_error("Server response doesn't contain any oBIX objects:\n"
00512                   "%s", text);
00513         free(text);
00514         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00515     }
00516 
00517     IXML_Element* element = ixmlNode_convertToElement(node);
00518     if (respElem != NULL)
00519     {
00520         *respElem = element;
00521     }
00522 
00523     if (strcmp(ixmlElement_getTagName(element), OBIX_OBJ_ERR) == 0)
00524     {
00525         char* text = ixmlPrintDocument(respDoc);
00526         log_error("Server replied with error:\n"
00527                   "%s", text);
00528         free(text);
00529         return OBIX_ERR_INVALID_STATE;
00530     }
00531 
00532     return OBIX_SUCCESS;
00533 }
00534 
00535 static int parseWatchOut(IXML_Document* doc,
00536                          Http_Connection* c,
00537                          CURL_EXT* curlHandle)
00538 {
00539     // usually DOM doc is provided by caller method (and cleaned also in it)
00540     // but sometimes we generate own one.
00541     BOOL needToCleanDoc = FALSE;
00542     IXML_Element* element = NULL;
00543     int error = parseResponse(doc, &element);
00544     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00545     {
00546         if (error != OBIX_ERR_INVALID_STATE)
00547         {
00548             return error;
00549         }
00550 
00551         // we received error object instead of WatchOut.
00552         // in case if it is BadUri than try to create new Watch object.
00553         const char* errType = ixmlElement_getAttribute(element, OBIX_ATTR_IS);
00554         if ((errType == NULL) || (strstr(errType, OBIX_HREF_ERR_BAD_URI) == NULL))
00555         {
00556             // it is some strange error. no idea what to do with it
00557             return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00558         }
00559 
00560         // it is badUri error which indicates (most probably it should :) that
00561         // the Watch object is unexpectedly deleted from oBIX server
00562         // (unfortunately it can happen :). Try to create new Watch.
00563         log_warning("It seems like Watch object doesn't exist on oBIX server "
00564                     "anymore.");
00565         error = recreateWatch(c, &doc, curlHandle);
00566         if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00567         {
00568             return error;
00569         }
00570 
00571         error = parseResponse(doc, &element);
00572         if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00573         {
00574             ixmlDocument_free(doc);
00575             return error;
00576         }
00577 
00578         // we have now own response generated by recreateWatch(), thus
00579         // we need to free it after everything is done
00580         needToCleanDoc = TRUE;
00581     }
00582 
00583 
00584     element = ixmlDocument_getElementByAttrValue(
00585                   doc,
00586                   OBIX_ATTR_NAME,
00587                   OBIX_WATCH_OUT_VALUES);
00588     if (element == NULL)
00589     {
00590         log_warning("WatchOut object returned by server doesn't contain "
00591                     "\"%s\" list.", OBIX_WATCH_OUT_VALUES);
00592         // try to get any list object
00593         element = ixmlDocument_getElementById(doc, OBIX_OBJ_LIST);
00594         if (element == NULL)
00595         {
00596             if (needToCleanDoc)
00597             {
00598                 ixmlDocument_free(doc);
00599             }
00600             return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00601         }
00602     }
00603 
00604     IXML_Node* node = ixmlNode_getFirstChild(ixmlElement_getNode(element));
00605     int retVal = OBIX_SUCCESS;
00606     for (;node != NULL; node = ixmlNode_getNextSibling(node))
00607     {
00608         element = ixmlNode_convertToElement(node);
00609         if (element == NULL)
00610         {
00611             char* text = ixmlPrintDocument(doc);
00612             log_warning("WatchOut object returned by server contains "
00613                         "something illegal:\n%s", text);
00614             free(text);
00615             retVal = OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00616             // ignore this node
00617             continue;
00618         }
00619         // check that this is not an error
00620         const char* tagName = ixmlElement_getTagName(element);
00621         if (strcmp(tagName, OBIX_OBJ_ERR) == 0)
00622         {
00623             char* text = ixmlPrintDocument(doc);
00624             log_warning("WatchOut contains error object:\n%s", text);
00625             free(text);
00626             retVal = OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00627             // ignore this node
00628             continue;
00629         }
00630         // get URI of the updated object
00631         const char* uri = ixmlElement_getAttribute(element, OBIX_ATTR_HREF);
00632         if (uri == NULL)
00633         {
00634             char* text = ixmlPrintDocument(doc);
00635             log_warning("WatchOut object returned by server contains "
00636                         "object without \"%s\" attribute:\n%s", OBIX_ATTR_HREF, text);
00637             free(text);
00638             retVal = OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00639             // ignore this node
00640             continue;
00641         }
00642 
00643         // if there is 'val' attribute in the returned object - return it,
00644         // otherwise, return the whole object
00645         // TODO fixme somehow
00646         char* newValue;
00647         const char* attrValue = ixmlElement_getAttribute(element, OBIX_ATTR_VAL);
00648 
00649         if (attrValue != NULL)
00650         {       // copy value
00651             newValue = ixmlCloneDOMString(attrValue);
00652         }
00653         else
00654         {       // return the whole object
00655             newValue = ixmlPrintNode(ixmlElement_getNode(element));
00656         }
00657 
00658         //        if (newValue == NULL)
00659         //        {
00660         //            char* text = ixmlPrintDocument(doc);
00661         //            log_warning("WatchOut object returned by server contains updated "
00662         //                        "object without \"%s\" attribute:\n%s", OBIX_ATTR_VAL, text);
00663         //            free(text);
00664         //            retVal = OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00665         //            // ignore this node
00666         //            continue;
00667         //        }
00668 
00669         // workaround for some oBIX server implementations which return full
00670         // URI of the updated object, but it should be the same as passed to
00671         // Watch.add operation.
00672         if (strncmp(c->serverUri, uri, c->serverUriLength) == 0)
00673         {
00674             uri += c->serverUriLength;
00675         }
00676 
00677         // find corresponding listener of the object
00678         Listener* listener = (Listener*) table_get(c->watchTable, uri);
00679         if (listener != NULL)
00680         {
00681             // execute callback function
00682             (listener->callback)(listener->connectionId,
00683                                  listener->deviceId,
00684                                  listener->id,
00685                                  newValue);
00686         }
00687         else
00688         {
00689             log_error("Unable to find listener for the object with URI \"%s\".", uri);
00690             retVal = OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00691         }
00692         ixmlFreeDOMString(newValue);
00693     }
00694 
00695     if (needToCleanDoc)
00696     {
00697         ixmlDocument_free(doc);
00698     }
00699     return retVal;
00700 }
00701 
00702 static void watchPollTask(void* arg)
00703 {
00704     Http_Connection* c = (Http_Connection*) arg;
00705 
00706     pthread_mutex_lock(c->watchMutex);
00707     if (c->watchPollChangesFullUri == NULL)
00708     {
00709         log_error("Watch Poll Task: Someone deleted Watch object but did not "
00710                   "cancel the poll task.");
00711         if (ptask_cancel(_watchThread, c->watchPollTaskId) != 0)
00712         {
00713             log_error("Watch Poll Task: Unable to delete myself.");
00714         }
00715         pthread_mutex_unlock(c->watchMutex);
00716         return;
00717     }
00718 
00719     log_debug("requesting %s", c->watchPollChangesFullUri);
00720     IXML_Document* response;
00721 
00722     int error = curl_ext_postDOM(_curl_watch_handle,
00723                                  c->watchPollChangesFullUri,
00724                                  &response);
00725     if (error != 0)
00726     {
00727         log_error("Watch Poll Task: "
00728                   "Unable to poll changes from the server %s.",
00729                   c->watchPollChangesFullUri);
00730         pthread_mutex_unlock(c->watchMutex);
00731         return;
00732     }
00733 
00734     error = parseWatchOut(response, c, _curl_watch_handle);
00735     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00736     {
00737         log_error("Watch Poll Task: "
00738                   "Unable to parse WatchOut object (error %d).", error);
00739     }
00740 
00741     pthread_mutex_unlock(c->watchMutex);
00742     ixmlDocument_free(response);
00743 }
00744 
00745 static int removeWatch(Http_Connection* c)
00746 {
00747     if (c->watchTable->count > 0)
00748     {
00749         log_warning("Deleting not empty watch object from the oBIX server. "
00750                     "Some subscribed listeners can stop receiving updates.");
00751     }
00752 
00753     // stop polling task
00754     int error = ptask_cancel(_watchThread, c->watchPollTaskId);
00755     if (error != 0)
00756     {
00757         log_error("Unable to cancel Watch Poll Task:"
00758                   "ptask_cancel() returned %d", error);
00759         return error;
00760     }
00761 
00762     // delete Watch object from the oBIX server
00763     char watchDeleteFullUri[c->serverUriLength
00764                             + strlen(c->watchDeleteUri) + 1];
00765     strcpy(watchDeleteFullUri, c->serverUri);
00766     strcat(watchDeleteFullUri, c->watchDeleteUri);
00767     _curl_handle->outputBuffer = NULL;
00768     IXML_Document* response;
00769     error = curl_ext_postDOM(_curl_handle,
00770                              watchDeleteFullUri,
00771                              &response);
00772     if (error != 0)
00773     {
00774         log_error("Unable to delete Watch from the server %s.",
00775                   watchDeleteFullUri);
00776         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00777     }
00778 
00779     if (response == NULL)
00780     {
00781         // server did not returned anything, but consider that
00782         // watch is removed
00783         log_warning("Server did not return anything for Watch.delete "
00784                     "operation (%s).", watchDeleteFullUri);
00785     }
00786     else
00787     {
00788         // check the response
00789         if (parseResponse(response, NULL) != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00790         {
00791             ixmlDocument_free(response);
00792             return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00793         }
00794 
00795         ixmlDocument_free(response);
00796     }
00797 
00798     // reset all Watch related variables, because they are no longer valid
00799     resetWatchUris(c);
00800 
00801     return OBIX_SUCCESS;
00802 }
00803 
00804 static int addListener(Http_Connection* c,
00805                        const char* paramUri,
00806                        Listener* listener)
00807 {
00808     // save listener to the listeners table
00809     pthread_mutex_lock(c->watchMutex);
00810     table_put(c->watchTable, paramUri, listener);
00811 
00812     // check that we already have a watch object for this server
00813     if (c->watchAddUri == NULL)
00814     {
00815         // create new one
00816         int error = createWatch(c, _curl_handle);
00817         if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00818         {
00819             pthread_mutex_unlock(c->watchMutex);
00820             return error;
00821         }
00822 
00823         // schedule polling task
00824         // schedule new periodic task for watch polling
00825         int ptaskId = ptask_schedule(_watchThread, &watchPollTask, c,
00826                                      c->pollInterval, EXECUTE_INDEFINITE);
00827         if (ptaskId < 0)
00828         {
00829             log_error("Unable to schedule Watch Poll Task: Not enough memory.");
00830             pthread_mutex_unlock(c->watchMutex);
00831             return OBIX_ERR_NO_MEMORY;
00832         }
00833         c->watchPollTaskId = ptaskId;
00834 
00835     }
00836     pthread_mutex_unlock(c->watchMutex);
00837 
00838     return OBIX_SUCCESS;
00839 }
00840 
00841 static int removeListener(Http_Connection* c, const char* paramUri)
00842 {
00843     // remove listener URI from the listeners table
00844     pthread_mutex_lock(c->watchMutex);
00845     table_remove(c->watchTable, paramUri);
00846 
00847     // remove Watch object  from the server completely
00848     // if there are no more items to watch
00849     int retVal = OBIX_SUCCESS;
00850     if (c->watchTable->count == 0)
00851     {
00852         retVal = removeWatch(c);
00853     }
00854     pthread_mutex_unlock(c->watchMutex);
00855 
00856     return retVal;
00857 }
00858 
00859 int http_init()
00860 {
00861     if (_initialized)
00862     {
00863         return OBIX_SUCCESS;
00864     }
00865 
00866     // initialize curl library
00867     // TODO get the buffer size from settings file
00868     int error = curl_ext_init(0);
00869     if (error != 0)
00870     {
00871         return OBIX_ERR_HTTP_LIB;
00872     }
00873     // initialize 2 curl handles: one for watch polling thread
00874     // and one for other calls.
00875     error = curl_ext_create(&_curl_handle);
00876     if (error != 0)
00877     {
00878         if (error == -2)
00879         {
00880             return OBIX_ERR_NO_MEMORY;
00881         }
00882         return OBIX_ERR_HTTP_LIB;
00883     }
00884     error = curl_ext_create(&_curl_watch_handle);
00885     if (error != 0)
00886     {
00887         if (error == -2)
00888         {
00889             return OBIX_ERR_NO_MEMORY;
00890         }
00891         return OBIX_ERR_HTTP_LIB;
00892     }
00893 
00894     //    curl_easy_setopt(_curl_watch_handle->curl, CURLOPT_VERBOSE, 1L);
00895     //    curl_easy_setopt(_curl_watch_handle->curl, CURLOPT_STDERR, stdout);
00896     //
00897     //    curl_easy_setopt(_curl_handle->curl, CURLOPT_VERBOSE, 1L);
00898     //    curl_easy_setopt(_curl_handle->curl, CURLOPT_STDERR, stdout);
00899 
00900     // initialize Periodic Task thread which will be used for watch polling
00901     _watchThread = ptask_init();
00902     if (_watchThread == NULL)
00903     {
00904         return OBIX_ERR_HTTP_LIB;
00905     }
00906 
00907     _initialized = TRUE;
00908     return OBIX_SUCCESS;
00909 }
00910 
00911 void http_dispose()
00912 {
00913     if (_initialized)
00914     {
00915         // destroy curl handles
00916         curl_ext_free(_curl_handle);
00917         curl_ext_free(_curl_watch_handle);
00918         // stop curl library
00919         curl_ext_dispose();
00920         // stop Periodic Task thread
00921         ptask_dispose(_watchThread);
00922     }
00923 
00924     _initialized = FALSE;
00925 }
00926 
00927 int http_initConnection(IXML_Element* connItem, Connection** connection)
00928 {
00929     char* serverUri = NULL;
00930     char* lobbyUri = NULL;
00931     Http_Connection* c;
00932     Table* table = NULL;
00933     pthread_mutex_t* mutex = NULL;
00934     long pollInterval = DEFAULT_POLLING_INTERVAL;
00935     long watchLease;
00936 
00937     // helper function for releasing resources on error
00938     void cleanup()
00939     {
00940         if (serverUri != NULL)
00941             free(serverUri);
00942         if (lobbyUri != NULL)
00943             free(lobbyUri);
00944         if (table != NULL)
00945             free(table);
00946         if (mutex != NULL)
00947             free(mutex);
00948     }
00949 
00950     // load server address
00951     IXML_Element* element = config_getChildTag(connItem, CT_SERVER_ADDRESS, TRUE);
00952     if (element == NULL)
00953     {
00954         return OBIX_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
00955     }
00956     const char* attrValue = config_getTagAttributeValue(element, CTA_VALUE, TRUE);
00957     if (attrValue == NULL)
00958     {
00959         return OBIX_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
00960     }
00961     // remove trailing slash from server address
00962     int serverUriLength = strlen(attrValue);
00963     if (attrValue[serverUriLength - 1] == '/')
00964     {
00965         serverUriLength--;
00966     }
00967     serverUri = (char*) malloc(serverUriLength + 1);
00968     if (serverUri == NULL)
00969     {
00970         log_error("Unable to initialize HTTP connection: Not enough memory.");
00971         cleanup();
00972         return OBIX_ERR_NO_MEMORY;
00973     }
00974     strncpy(serverUri, attrValue, serverUriLength);
00975     serverUri[serverUriLength] = '\0';
00976     // load Lobby object address
00977     attrValue = config_getTagAttributeValue(element, CTA_LOBBY, TRUE);
00978     if (attrValue == NULL)
00979     {
00980         cleanup();
00981         return OBIX_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
00982     }
00983     // we don't want lobby uri contain server address
00984     if (strncmp(attrValue, serverUri, serverUriLength) == 0)
00985     {
00986         attrValue += serverUriLength;
00987     }
00988     if (*attrValue != '/')
00989     {
00990         log_error("Attribute \"%s\" of configuration tag <%s/> has wrong "
00991                   "value: It should contain absolute address of the Lobby "
00992                   "object.", CTA_LOBBY, CT_SERVER_ADDRESS);
00993         cleanup();
00994         return OBIX_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
00995     }
00996     lobbyUri = (char*) malloc(strlen(attrValue) + 1);
00997     if (lobbyUri == NULL)
00998     {
00999         log_error("Unable to initialize HTTP connection: Not enough memory.");
01000         cleanup();
01001         return OBIX_ERR_NO_MEMORY;
01002     }
01003     strcpy(lobbyUri, attrValue);
01004     // load watch poll interval, this is optional parameter
01005     element = config_getChildTag(connItem, CT_POLL_INTERVAL, FALSE);
01006     if (element != NULL)
01007     {
01008         pollInterval = config_getTagLongAttrValue(
01009                            element,
01010                            CTA_VALUE,
01011                            FALSE,
01012                            DEFAULT_POLLING_INTERVAL);
01013     }
01014     // load watch lease time, this is also optional parameter
01015     // by default it is pollInterval + padding
01016     watchLease = pollInterval + DEFAULT_WATCH_LEASE_PADDING;
01017     element = config_getChildTag(connItem, CT_WATCH_LEASE, FALSE);
01018     if (element != NULL)
01019     {
01020         watchLease = config_getTagLongAttrValue(
01021                          element,
01022                          CTA_VALUE,
01023                          FALSE,
01024                          pollInterval + DEFAULT_WATCH_LEASE_PADDING);
01025     }
01026 
01027     // allocate space for the connection object
01028     int listenerMaxCount = (*connection)->maxDevices * (*connection)->maxListeners;
01029     c = (Http_Connection*) realloc(*connection, sizeof(Http_Connection));
01030     if (c == NULL)
01031     {
01032         log_error("Unable to initialize HTTP connection: Not enough memory.");
01033         cleanup();
01034         return OBIX_ERR_NO_MEMORY;
01035     }
01036     *connection = &(c->c);
01037 
01038     table = table_create(listenerMaxCount);
01039     mutex = (pthread_mutex_t*) malloc(sizeof(pthread_mutex_t));
01040     if ((table == NULL) || (mutex == NULL))
01041     {
01042         log_error("Unable to initialize HTTP connection: Not enough memory.");
01043         cleanup();
01044         return OBIX_ERR_NO_MEMORY;
01045     }
01046 
01047     if (pthread_mutex_init(mutex, NULL) != 0)
01048     {
01049         log_error("Unable to initialize HTTP connection: Unable to create mutex.");
01050         cleanup();
01051         return OBIX_ERR_HTTP_LIB;
01052     }
01053     c->watchTable = table;
01054     c->watchMutex = mutex;
01055 
01056     c->serverUri = serverUri;
01057     c->serverUriLength = serverUriLength;
01058     c->lobbyUri = lobbyUri;
01059     c->pollInterval = pollInterval;
01060     c->watchLease = watchLease;
01061 
01062     // initialize other values with zeros
01063     c->signUpUri = NULL;
01064     c->watchMakeUri = NULL;
01065     c->watchAddUri = NULL;
01066     c->watchDeleteUri = NULL;
01067     c->watchPollChangesFullUri = NULL;
01068     c->watchRemoveUri = NULL;
01069 
01070     return OBIX_SUCCESS;
01071 }
01072 
01073 void http_freeConnection(Connection* connection)
01074 {
01075     // free all specific attributes of HTTP connection
01076     Http_Connection* c = getHttpConnection(connection);
01077     if (c->serverUri != NULL)
01078         free(c->serverUri);
01079     if (c->lobbyUri != NULL)
01080         free(c->lobbyUri);
01081     if (c->signUpUri != NULL)
01082         free(c->signUpUri);
01083     if (c->watchMakeUri != NULL)
01084         free(c->watchMakeUri);
01085     resetWatchUris(c);
01086     if (c->watchMutex != NULL)
01087     {
01088         pthread_mutex_destroy(c->watchMutex);
01089         free(c->watchMutex);
01090     }
01091     if (c->watchTable != 0)
01092     {
01093         table_free(c->watchTable);
01094     }
01095 }
01096 
01097 int http_openConnection(Connection* connection)
01098 {
01099     char* signUpUri = NULL;
01100     char* watchServiceUri = NULL;
01101     IXML_Document* response = NULL;
01102 
01103     // helper function for releasing resources on error
01104     void cleanup()
01105     {
01106         if (signUpUri != NULL)
01107             free(signUpUri);
01108         if (watchServiceUri != NULL)
01109             free(watchServiceUri);
01110         if (response != NULL)
01111             ixmlDocument_free(response);
01112     }
01113 
01114     Http_Connection* c = getHttpConnection(connection);
01115     log_debug("Trying to connect to the oBIX server \"%s\".", c->serverUri);
01116     // try get Lobby object from the server
01117     char lobbyFullUri[strlen(c->serverUri) + strlen(c->lobbyUri) + 1];
01118     strcpy(lobbyFullUri, c->serverUri);
01119     strcat(lobbyFullUri, c->lobbyUri);
01120     curl_ext_getDOM(_curl_handle, lobbyFullUri, &response);
01121     if ((response == NULL) || (parseResponse(response, NULL) != OBIX_SUCCESS))
01122     {
01123         log_error("Unable to get Lobby object from the oBIX server \"%s\".",
01124                   lobbyFullUri);
01125         cleanup();
01126         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
01127     }
01128 
01129     // we need to save links to watchService.make and signUp operations.
01130     signUpUri = getObjectUri(response,
01131                              OBIX_NAME_SIGN_UP,
01132                              c, FALSE);
01133     watchServiceUri = getObjectUri(response,
01134                                    OBIX_NAME_WATCH_SERVICE,
01135                                    c, TRUE);
01136     // we do not fail if there is no signUp object on the server:
01137     // it means that we can't register new device at this server, but
01138     // we are still able to register listeners and write data to it.
01139     if (watchServiceUri == NULL)
01140     {   // unable to retrieve correct URI from objects
01141         cleanup();
01142         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
01143     }
01144     // now get watchService object
01145     ixmlDocument_free(response);
01146     response = NULL;
01147     curl_ext_getDOM(_curl_handle, watchServiceUri, &response);
01148     if ((response == NULL) || (parseResponse(response, NULL) != OBIX_SUCCESS))
01149     {
01150         log_error("Unable to get watchService object from the oBIX server "
01151                   "\"%s\".", watchServiceUri);
01152         cleanup();
01153         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
01154     }
01155     // now get URI of watchService.make operation
01156     free(watchServiceUri);
01157     watchServiceUri = getObjectUri(response,
01158                                    OBIX_NAME_WATCH_SERVICE_MAKE,
01159                                    c, FALSE);
01160     if (watchServiceUri == NULL)
01161     {   // unable to retrieve correct URI from objects
01162         cleanup();
01163         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
01164     }
01165 
01166     ixmlDocument_free(response);
01167 
01168     c->signUpUri = signUpUri;
01169     c->watchMakeUri = watchServiceUri;
01170     return OBIX_SUCCESS;
01171 }
01172 
01173 int http_closeConnection(Connection* connection)
01174 {
01175     Http_Connection* c = getHttpConnection(connection);
01176     int retVal = OBIX_SUCCESS;
01177 
01178     log_debug("Closing connection to the server %s...", c->serverUri);
01179     // remove Watch and polling task if they were not removed earlier
01180     pthread_mutex_lock(c->watchMutex);
01181     if (c->watchDeleteUri != NULL)
01182     {
01183         retVal = removeWatch(c);
01184     }
01185     pthread_mutex_unlock(c->watchMutex);
01186 
01187     return retVal;
01188 }
01189 
01190 int http_registerDevice(Connection* connection, Device** device, const char* data)
01191 {
01192     Http_Connection* c = getHttpConnection(connection);
01193     log_debug("Registering device at the server %s...", c->serverUri);
01194     if (c->signUpUri == NULL)
01195     {
01196         log_error("Unable to register device: "
01197                   "oBIX server \"%s\" doesn't support signUp feature.",
01198                   c->serverUri);
01199         return OBIX_ERR_INVALID_STATE;
01200     }
01201 
01202     // register new device at the server
01203     _curl_handle->outputBuffer = data;
01204     char signUpFullUri[c->serverUriLength + strlen(c->signUpUri) + 1];
01205     strcpy(signUpFullUri, c->serverUri);
01206     strcat(signUpFullUri, c->signUpUri);
01207     IXML_Document* response;
01208     curl_ext_postDOM(_curl_handle, signUpFullUri, &response);
01209     if (response == NULL)
01210     {
01211         log_error("Unable to register device using service at \"%s\".",
01212                   signUpFullUri);
01213         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
01214     }
01215 
01216     // check response
01217     IXML_Element* element;
01218     int error = parseResponse(response, &element);
01219     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
01220     {
01221         if (error != OBIX_ERR_INVALID_STATE)
01222         {
01223             ixmlDocument_free(response);
01224             return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
01225         }
01226         // Server returned error object.
01227         // TODO that is a workaround which works only with oBIX server
01228         // from same project. When driver is restarted, it appears that
01229         // data already exists on the server. If it is, than error message
01230         // would contain URI of the existing data which we will try to use.
01231         const char* attrValue = ixmlElement_getAttribute(
01232                                     element,
01233                                     OBIX_ATTR_HREF);
01234 
01235         if ((attrValue == NULL) || (strstr(attrValue, signUpFullUri) != NULL))
01236         {
01237             // server returned unknown error. Nothing can be done.
01238             ixmlDocument_free(response);
01239             return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
01240         }
01241 
01242         // Server returned error with URI of the object which already exists
01243         // on it. Thus signUp failed, but required data is already published
01244         // (at least we hope so :)
01245         char* uri = ixmlCloneDOMString(attrValue);
01246         ixmlDocument_free(response);
01247         response = NULL;
01248         curl_ext_getDOM(_curl_handle, uri, &response);
01249         if ((response == NULL) ||
01250                 (parseResponse(response, NULL) != OBIX_SUCCESS))
01251         {
01252             // It's a pity but our hopes did not come true :) URI from the
01253             // error object did not contain any good data
01254             if (response != NULL)
01255             {
01256                 ixmlDocument_free(response);
01257             }
01258             free(uri);
01259             return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
01260         }
01261 
01262         // It seems that workaround works so far, so let's continue with this
01263         // received object. But still there is a possibility that the received
01264         // object is not what we wanted to post on the server :)
01265         log_warning("signUp operation at oBIX server returned error, telling "
01266                     "that the object with provided URI already exists. Trying to "
01267                     "proceed with object with URI \"%s\".", uri);
01268         free(uri);
01269     }
01270 
01271     // save actual device URI
01272     const char* attrValue = ixmlElement_getAttribute(element, OBIX_ATTR_HREF);
01273     if (attrValue == NULL)
01274     {
01275         ixmlDocument_free(response);
01276         log_error("Object in server response doesn't contain \"%s\" "
01277                   "attribute:\n%s", OBIX_ATTR_HREF, _curl_handle->inputBuffer);
01278         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
01279     }
01280     // remove server address from the uri
01281     const char* uri = removeServerAddress(attrValue, c);
01282 
01283     // create device object
01284     Http_Device* d = (Http_Device*) realloc(*device, sizeof(Http_Device));
01285     if (d == NULL)
01286     {
01287         ixmlDocument_free(response);
01288         log_error("Unable to create device: Not enough memory.");
01289         return OBIX_ERR_NO_MEMORY;
01290     }
01291     *device = &(d->d);
01292 
01293     char* deviceUri = (char*) malloc(strlen(uri) + 1);
01294     if (deviceUri == NULL)
01295     {
01296         ixmlDocument_free(response);
01297         log_error("Unable to create device: Not enough memory.");
01298         return OBIX_ERR_NO_MEMORY;
01299     }
01300 
01301     strcpy(deviceUri, uri);
01302     ixmlDocument_free(response);
01303     d->uri = deviceUri;
01304     d->uriLength = strlen(deviceUri);
01305 
01306     return OBIX_SUCCESS;
01307 }
01308 
01309 int http_unregisterDevice(Connection* connection, Device* device)
01310 {
01311     // TODO implement me
01312     log_debug("Unregistering device from the server %s",
01313               getHttpConnection(connection)->serverUri);
01314     log_warning("Unfortunately driver unregistering is not supported yet.");
01315 
01316     Http_Device* d = getHttpDevice(device);
01317     free(d->uri);
01318     return 0;
01319 }
01320 
01321 int http_registerListener(Connection* connection, Device* device, Listener** listener)
01322 {
01323     Http_Connection* c = getHttpConnection(connection);
01324     Http_Device* d = NULL;
01325 
01326     log_debug("Registering listener of parameter \"%s\" at the server "
01327               "\"%s\"...", (*listener)->paramUri, c->serverUri);
01328     int fullParamUriLength = strlen((*listener)->paramUri) + 1;
01329     if (device != NULL)
01330     {   // need to add device URI
01331         d = getHttpDevice(device);
01332         fullParamUriLength += d->uriLength;
01333     }
01334     char fullParamUri[fullParamUriLength];
01335     if (device == NULL)
01336     {
01337         strcpy(fullParamUri, (*listener)->paramUri);
01338     }
01339     else
01340     {
01341         strcpy(fullParamUri, d->uri);
01342         strcat(fullParamUri, (*listener)->paramUri);
01343     }
01344     int error = addListener(c, fullParamUri, *listener);
01345     if(error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
01346     {
01347         return error;
01348     }
01349 
01350     IXML_Document* response = NULL;
01351     char* p = fullParamUri;
01352     error = addWatchItem(c, (const char**) (&p), 1, &response, _curl_handle);
01353     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
01354     {
01355         removeListener(c, fullParamUri);
01356         return error;
01357     }
01358 
01359     error = parseWatchOut(response, c, _curl_handle);
01360     ixmlDocument_free(response);
01361     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
01362     {
01363         removeListener(c, fullParamUri);
01364     }
01365 
01366     return error;
01367 }
01368 
01369 int http_unregisterListener(Connection* connection, Device* device, Listener* listener)
01370 {
01371     Http_Connection* c = getHttpConnection(connection);
01372     Http_Device* d = NULL;
01373 
01374     log_debug("Removing listener of parameter \"%s\" at the server \"%s\"...",
01375               listener->paramUri, c->serverUri);
01376     int fullParamUriLength = strlen(listener->paramUri) + 1;
01377 
01378     if (device != NULL)
01379     {   // need to add device URI
01380         d = getHttpDevice(device);
01381         fullParamUriLength += d->uriLength;
01382     }
01383 
01384     // generate full listeners URI
01385     char fullParamUri[fullParamUriLength];
01386     if (device == NULL)
01387     {
01388         strcpy(fullParamUri, listener->paramUri);
01389     }
01390     else
01391     {
01392         strcpy(fullParamUri, d->uri);
01393         strcat(fullParamUri, listener->paramUri);
01394     }
01395 
01396     // remove that URI from the Watch object at the oBIX server
01397     // get URI of Watch.remove operation
01398     char fullWatchRemoveUri[c->serverUriLength + strlen(c->watchRemoveUri) + 1];
01399     strcpy(fullWatchRemoveUri, c->serverUri);
01400     strcat(fullWatchRemoveUri, c->watchRemoveUri);
01401 
01402     // send request
01403     char* p = fullParamUri;
01404     char* requestBody = getWatchInString((const char**) (&p), 1);
01405     if (requestBody == NULL)
01406     {
01407         log_error("Unable to unregister listener: Not enough memory.");
01408         return OBIX_ERR_NO_MEMORY;
01409     }
01410     _curl_handle->outputBuffer = requestBody;
01411     IXML_Document* response;
01412     int error = curl_ext_postDOM(_curl_handle, fullWatchRemoveUri, &response);
01413     free(requestBody);
01414     if (error != 0)
01415     {
01416         log_error("Unable to remove watch item from the server %s.",
01417                   fullWatchRemoveUri);
01418         return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
01419     }
01420 
01421     if (response == NULL)
01422     {   // server did not returned anything, but consider that
01423         // watch item is removed
01424         log_warning("Server did not return anything for Watch.remove "
01425                     "operation (%s).", fullWatchRemoveUri);
01426     }
01427     else
01428     {   // check server response
01429         if (parseResponse(response, NULL) != OBIX_SUCCESS)
01430         {
01431             ixmlDocument_free(response);
01432             return OBIX_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION;
01433         }
01434         ixmlDocument_free(response);
01435     }
01436 
01437     return removeListener(c, fullParamUri);
01438 }
01439 
01440 int http_writeValue(Connection* connection, Device* device, const char* paramUri, const char* newValue, OBIX_DATA_TYPE dataType)
01441 {
01442     Http_Connection* c = getHttpConnection(connection);
01443     Http_Device* d = NULL;
01444 
01445     log_debug("Writing new value for the object \"%s\" at the server %s...",
01446               paramUri, c->serverUri);
01447 
01448     int paramFullUriLength = c->serverUriLength + strlen(paramUri) + 1;
01449     if (device != NULL)
01450     {   // need to add device uri also
01451         d = getHttpDevice(device);
01452         paramFullUriLength += d->uriLength;
01453     }
01454 
01455 
01456     char paramFullUri[paramFullUriLength];
01457     strcpy(paramFullUri, c->serverUri);
01458     if (device != NULL)
01459     {
01460         strcat(paramFullUri, d->uri);
01461     }
01462     strcat(paramFullUri, paramUri);
01463     return writeValue(paramFullUri, newValue, dataType, _curl_handle);
01464 }
